This article describes the first album in the UK _Now!_ series. It should not
be confused with similarly-titled first albums in other _Now!_ series. For
more information, see [Now That's What I Call Music!
(disambiguation)](/wiki/Now_That%27s_What_I_Call_Music!_\(disambiguation\)
"Now That's What I Call Music! \(disambiguation\)") and [Now That's What I
Call Music! discography](/wiki/Now_That%27s_What_I_Call_Music!_discography
"Now That's What I Call Music! discography")

_**Now That 's What I Call Music**_ (also simply titled _**Now**_ or _**Now
1**_) is the first album from the popular
_[Now!](/wiki/Now_That%27s_What_I_Call_Music! "Now That's What I Call
Music!")_ series that was released in the United Kingdom on 28 November
1983.[1] Initial pressings were released on [vinyl](/wiki/Gramophone_record
"Gramophone record") and [audio cassette](/wiki/Audio_cassette "Audio
cassette"). To celebrate the 25th anniversary of the album and series, the
album was re-released on [CD](/wiki/Compact_disc "Compact disc") for the first
time in 2009. However, alternative longer mixes of Only For Love, Double Dutch
and Candy Girl were included in place of the original shorter single mixes
from 1983.[2] A double vinyl re-release followed for [Record Store
Day](/wiki/Record_Store_Day "Record Store Day") on 18 April 2015.[3] In July
2018, the album was newly remastered and re-released on CD, vinyl and cassette
to commemorate the release of the 100th volume of the series.[4]

In December 1983, the compilation debuted at number seven on the [UK Albums
Chart](/wiki/UK_Albums_Chart "UK Albums Chart") and reached number one a week
later, staying at the top for five non-consecutive weeks.[5]

## Now What's What I Call Music
Video[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Now_That%27s_What_I_Call_Music_\(original_UK_album\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Now What's What I Call Music Video")]

A video selection was also released featuring selected tracks from the main
album, one track that later featured on [Volume
II](/wiki/Now_That%27s_What_I_Call_Music_II_\(UK_series\) "Now That's What I
Call Music II \(UK series\)") of the series and two which did not appear on
any _Now_ album.

  1. Phil Collins : "You Can't Hurry Love"
  2. Duran Duran : "Is There Something I Should Know"
  3. UB40 : "Red Red Wine"
  4. Limahl : "Only for Love"
  5. Heaven 17 : "Temptation"
  6. Malcolm McLaren : "Double Dutch"
  7. Culture Club : "Karma Chameleon"
  8. Men Without Hats : "The Safety Dance"
  9. Kajagoogoo : "Too Shy"
  10. Mike Oldfield : "Moonlight Shadow"
  11. Rock Steady Crew : "(Hey You) The Rock Steady Crew"
  12. Tina Turner : "Let's Stay Together"
  13. [Freeez](/wiki/Freeez "Freeez") : "[I.O.U.](/wiki/I.O.U._\(Freeez_song\) "I.O.U. \(Freeez song\)")" †
  14. Howard Jones : "New Song"
  15. UB40 : "Please Don't Make Me Cry"
  16. Will Powers : "Kissing with Confidence"
  17. Genesis : "That's All"
  18. Kajagoogoo : "Big Apple"
  19. [The Assembly](/wiki/The_Assembly "The Assembly") : "[Never Never](/wiki/Never_Never_\(The_Assembly_song\) "Never Never \(The Assembly song\)")" †
  20. [Thompson Twins](/wiki/Thompson_Twins "Thompson Twins") : "[Hold Me Now](/wiki/Hold_Me_Now_\(Thompson_Twins_song\) "Hold Me Now \(Thompson Twins song\)")" ††
  21. Peabo Bryson & Roberta Flack : "Tonight I Celebrate My Love"

† Never appeared on any of the numbered _NOW_ albums but did appear on Now
1983 in the 10th Anniversary Series.[6][7][8]

†† Later appeared on _NOW 2_.
